intro: Oldenlandia affinis subsp. fugax, commonly known as the quicksilver vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, three-lobed leaves that are often hairy, and its flowers emit a mild fragrance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The subspecies fugax is distinguished by its rapid growth and shorter flowering period compared to other subspecies.
